hanzi-su-wiki:
棒

Значения

Палка, шест; черта, линяя

Мнемоника

Деревянный 木 боевой посох, преподносимый 奉 воину.
purpleculture_pinyin:
bàng
stick; club; cudgel; smart; capable; strong; wonderful; classifier for legs of a relay race
палка; клуб; дубина; умная; способный; сильный; чудесно; классификатор этапов эстафеты
rtega_mnemonic:
棒棒RSstick, club, truncheon, hit
  • branch of wood 木 held with two hands 奉
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 奉 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
棒球 [ bàng qiú ]: baseball; Classifiers: 个
棍棒 [ gùn bàng ]: club; staff; stick
棒槌 [ bàng chuí ]: wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
接力棒 [ jiē lì bàng ]: relay baton; (fig.) responsibilities (passed over to one's successor)
指挥棒 [ zhǐ huī bàng ]: baton
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 奉 [ fèng ] to offer, to respect, to server; to receive
heisig_chinese_memo: Buddhist monks, during meditation, are slapped with cudgels (short thick sticks) made from tree wood, to stay dedicated to their task. A lack of dedication means they are not truly proffering themselves.
heisig_constituent: rod, tree, wood, observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk
Keyword_KANJIDIC: rod, stick, cane, pole, club, line
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: стержень, палка, трость, шест, клуб, линия
koohiiStory1: This wooden rod has one very simple dedication engraved on it: "Spare the rod, spoil the child...".
koohiiStory2: The wood from this tree is dedicated to making rods to flog naughty kids.
jp_example_words:
鉄棒(かなぼう): iron rod, crowbar, horizontal bar (gymnastics)
棒(ぼう): pole, rod, stick
泥棒(どろぼう): robber
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tree in spring that's nice and dry will make a good pole or rod. Break it out of the ground and it's just flexible enough for tons of applications.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Use this pole to hang your towels or curtains. Ooh, use it to pole vault!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After much deliberation, you decide to use this pole to go bowling (ぼう). You line up a few more poles for the pins, and roll a rock toward them.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You decide to name this super hard, pole bowling tree-poll-pin bowling. Even harder than candlepin. The thinnest, most extreme pole bowling of all time!
Ru_Meaning: rod, stick, cane, pole, club, line
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 俸 (ホウ жалованье), 捧 (ささげる、ホウ поднимать, преподносить).

  • узор из полос

Ru_trainchinese: bàng: (прил/сущ) (разг.) замечательный, потрясающий, отличный; палка, дубина; длина одного этапа в эстафете
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the tree (木) is presented (奉) as a pole
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Buddhist monks, during meditation, are slapped with cudgels (short thick sticks) made from tree wood, to stay dedicated to their task. A lack of dedication means they are not truly proffering themselves.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " wood " and " bong ", the original meaning is stick and crutches, and it is also called " chall ". Jin Cuibao's "Annotation to Ancient and Modern ‧ Yufu": "The Han Dynasty held the Jinwu, and the Jinwu was also great. The copper was used for it, and the gold was painted with two ends, which is called the Jinwu."

" Stick " can mean hitting with a stick. "The Book of Northern Qi-The Biography of the King of Langya": "Wei's old system, Zhongcheng came out, cleared the road, and branched with the crown prince. The princes all stayed in the car away, went to the cow, and yoke on the ground, waiting for Zhongcheng to pass. If you violate it, you’ll be dead.”

" Bang " is also used as a quantifier. "Water Margin" Chapter 99: "I could only hear the sound of a gong, and a powerful army came out at the foot of the hillside behind the forest."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and " bong ", the original meaning is stick and crutch, and it is also called " chat ".
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「奉」聲，本義為棍子、拐杖，也作「棓」。晉崔豹《古今注‧輿服》：「漢朝執金吾，金吾亦棒也，以銅為之，黃金塗兩末，謂為金吾。」

　　「棒」可表示用棍棒擊打。《北齊書‧瑯玡王儼傳》：「魏氏舊制，中丞出，清道，與皇太子分路行，王公皆遙住車，去牛，頓軛於地，以待中丞過，其或遲違，則赤棒棒之。」

　　「棒」還用作量詞。《水滸傳》第99回：「只聽得一棒鑼聲向處，林子背後山坡腳邊撞出一彪軍來。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「奉」聲，本義為棍子、拐杖，也作「棓」。

鉄棒(かなぼう): iron rod, crowbar, horizontal bar (gymnastics)
棒(ぼう): pole, rod, stick
泥棒(どろぼう): robber
從「 木 」，「 奉 」聲，本義為棍子、拐杖，也作「 棓 」。晉崔豹《古今注‧輿服》：「漢朝執金吾，金吾亦棒也，以銅為之，黃金塗兩末，謂為金吾。」 「 棒 」可表示用棍棒擊打。《北齊書‧瑯玡王儼傳》：「魏氏舊制，中丞出，清道，與皇太子分路行，王公皆遙住車，去牛，頓軛於地，以待中丞過，其或遲違，則赤棒棒之。」 「 棒 」還用作量詞。《水滸傳》第99回：「只聽得一棒鑼聲向處，林子背後山坡腳邊撞出一彪軍來。」
From the sound of " wood" and " bong", the original meaning is stick and crutches, and it is also called " chall". Jin Cuibao's "Annotation to Ancient and Modern ‧ Yufu": "The Han Dynasty held the Jinwu, and the Jinwu was also great. The copper was used for it, and the gold was painted with two ends, which is called the Jinwu." " Stick" can mean hitting with a stick. "The Book of Northern Qi-The Biography of the King of Langya": "Wei's old system, Zhongcheng came out, cleared the road, and branched with the crown prince. The princes all stayed in the car away, went to the cow, and yoke on the ground, waiting for Zhongcheng to pass. If you violate it, you’ll be dead.” " Bang" is also used as a quantifier. "Water Margin" Chapter 99: "I could only hear the sound of a gong, and a powerful army came out at the foot of the hillside behind the forest."

Strong physical strength, great ability, good grades, high level: good homework. Good body.

Baton
Source glyph
Baton
Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to a stick; the extension is physical strength, strong ability, high level, and good grades.
bàng
I сущ
1) палка, дубинка; жезл (напр., полицейского)
把棒呼狗 отгонять палкой собаку
指挥棒 дирижерская палочка
2) спорт лапта, бита
3) тех. стержень
铀棒 урановый стержень (реактора)
II гл.
1) ударить, побить (палкой)
棒之 ударить его палкой
2) будд. воздействовать на учеников жезлом
III прил. /наречие
1) диал. крепкий, сильный, здоровый; здорово, хорошо
棒小伙子 крепкий парень (молодец)
字写得棒 хорошо пишет иероглифы!
2) диал. твёрдый; жёсткий
肉没煮烂, 还棒着哪! мясо не сварилось, оно ещё жёсткое!
3) разг. крутой, классный
那太棒了 вот это здорово!, великолепно!
Radicals: 木, 干  (tree, dry, spring)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tree in spring that's nice and dry will make a good pole or rod. Break it out of the ground and it's just flexible enough for tons of applications.
Use this pole to hang your towels or curtains. Ooh, use it to pole vault!
Reading Mnemonic
After much deliberation, you decide to use this pole to go bowling (ぼう). You line up a few more poles for the pins, and roll a rock toward them.
You decide to name this super hard, pole bowling tree-poll-pin bowling. Even harder than candlepin. The thinnest, most extreme pole bowling of all time!
